reviewText: Most people think of Smokey Robinson as a great pop singer, which, of course, he is.  However, I remember Smokey as a legit soul man as well.  This collection proves he was/is both.  His performance on "You Really Got A Hold On Me" places him right there with the best soul singers. The Miracles were a great group.  This set is a must have if you like the Tamla/Motown sound.
Title: N/A

reviewText: all I know is, I already BOUGHT "the best of Mowtown" DVD, which looks to be in the very same series, and it was 95% clips from early TV with the actual hit record superimposed OVER the footage, like they do in these awful PBS specials they have been smothering people with lately. Dude, I WANT TO HEAR THE PERFORMERS SING LIVE! I dont want Kareeokie. Not only that, but it is annoying as all hell to watch grainy footage from the 50s and 60s juxtaposed with a perfect sounding stero recording pasted right over the picture, it sticks out like a sore thumb. I want them to match- I DONT CARE IF THE SOUND IS POOR- I just dont want nothing phoney. You people are phoney, at least you were when you put out "the Motown story" This is how I feelThats why I can't buy this one, even tho I love the Miricles. Once bitten, twice shy. NOW BITE ME!And not only that, but the miricles have never performed some of their best things, EG. "whats so good about goodbye" , "you really got a hold on me", "i been good to you" etc. on TV

reviewText: This DVD was bought as a gift for my husband. We loved the performances and it was especially nice to see the evolution of not only "Smokey" but also the other members of the "Miracles." The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 were two things I found kind of disappointing with the DVD. One was the fact that Mrs. Claudette Robinson was not included in the commentaries that are interspersed throughout the DVD. And, I also was not thrilled with the way Mr. Robinson keep trying the steal the limelight during the interviews, although my daughter did comment later that it was a good thing that he did most of the talking because the other guys weren't as well spoken. Other than those two little annoyances it was a great DVD to add to my husband's collection. I loved each and every one of the selections included as have other people my husband has let watch his DVD. Please add this one to your collection of one of the best of the golden. It is well worth the price and a bargain at that. Loved it.

Title: N/A

reviewText: I first heard Smokey and the Miracles in 1961. During that summer, my black friends played one of his early albums and I fell in love with "Bad Girl" and "Way Over There." Smokey's talent and song writing were unique then as they are now. It is also good to see old friends are still very good old friends. The interviews (while very Motown patterned) are constructed to let you hear their structured message. However, it is clear that the surviving members (minus Claudette) still have great afection for each other.As I listen to the performances, it is also clear how important Claudette's voice was to the recordings and I would have loved to hear from her. This is an excellent portrait of a great American artist and his musical team. Smokey makes the other Motown players seem small and this is clearly not the case. It is just that he was head and shoulders above his "peers."Top notch production is Motown's code and this is a welcome addition to my musical memories. These old TV appearances are clearly a bit dated but are wonderful to see. These folks were great live.
summary: I have loved this man's work  since 1960

reviewText: Universal has been issuing some really good music dvds for various Motown acts within the past year or so, and this is one of the best of them.  Not only does this contain about 10 performances by Smokey and the Miracles (some with live audio from the TV shows back in the '60s, some with newly synched stereo audio for improved sound quality), a couple of '70s hits from the Miracles after Smokey left, and then a few solo Smokey hits; but before each track there are reminiscences by some of the Miracles about the creation of these wonderful songs.  Also included are some a cappella mixes of the songs.  If you have the similarly wonderful Marvin Gaye dvd that came out about a year ago, then you'll have a reference point as to how good this is.  The recently released Supremes dvd may surpass this in terms of number of music performances, but it pales when compared based on additional features (perhaps because it would be impossible to have the surviving Supremes sit down together and have a pleasant interview).
summary: Extremely entertaining, chock full of great performances and interview segments

reviewText: If anyone rates this with 4 and 5 stars, they must be thinking about the conversations between Smokey and the other two Miracles!  This DVD is nothing but a "talking interview."  I expected to see Smokey and the Miracles in action!  Too much talking -- not enough singing and dancing.  If you want to see an interview throughout the whole DVD, then this is the DVD for you.

reviewText: As a Smokey Robinson & The Miracles DVD, this collection of their great songs is good and well mastered. This DVD collection could have been a great had most of Smokey Robinson's solo songs (e.g. Let Me be the Clock, One Heartbeat, etc.), been included in the DVD. The DVD shows the very young Smokey and the original members of the Miracles. This DVD is a good reflection of one of the greatest soul groups of all time - Smokey Robinson & The Miracles.

reviewText: This collection exceeded my expectations and curiosity.  As always with Reelin' In the Years and UMe, they have put together a great DVD complete with great liner notes by Rob Bowman, never before seen photos, and an impressive track listing which includes clips from popular shows such as Murray the K, The Mike Douglas Show, and Dinah!There are nine Smokey and the Miracles tracks showing them performing their biggest hits like SHOP AROUND, MICKEY'S MONKEY & GOING TO A GO-GO.  Also, 2 performances with Smokey's replacement, Billy Griffin (in shocking pink suits :-)) on the Dinah! Show singing DO IT BABY and LOVE MACHINE are awesome as well as 3 solo performances from Smokey (CRUSIN', BEING WITH YOU, & JUST TO SEE HER).The only thing is during the clip for GOING TO A GO-GO, please don't be alarmed: probably during the actual taping on Swingin' Time in 1965, someone was probably trying to adjust the camera during Smokey's close-up and it's a little distorted for about 3 seconds.  But, this is before television pre-emption.  When you were on LIVE, you were on LIVE! :-)A touching moment in the beginning of the credits: Smokey, Bobby, and Pete share warm embraces probably at the start of their interviews.  And during their interviews, they laugh and joke as if they were still youngin's, reminiscing about their days at Motown.  Also, we see rare footage at Hitsville and photos of Smokey and the Miracles while the credits roll.We also see during the bonus features part of the DVD an extended interview section and we watch them view their 1963 performance at the Apollo for the first time since they taped that performance.  And as always, 8 crystal-clear acapella performances of their biggest hits!Another addition and a must have for music fans!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This video production company is bringing the stories and best classic performances of some of the musical greats to us with their documentaries. The interviews are enlightening, the music stellar......I highly recommend any of them but this one on Smokey Robinson and The Miracles is one of the best I have seen.

reviewText: Before I comment on this dvd , I'd like to make a few observations. First, this collection was supposed to have been released last year as the very FIRST of the "MOTOWN DEFINITIVE DVD" collections. It was advertised widely on the internet , and in record stores under the name " SMOKEY ROBINSON: MY WORLD- THE DEFINITIVE DVD COLLECTION,(along with a companion cd release of the same name). It was even, until very recently, advertised right here on AMAZON,but,it was withdrawn,and replaced with this collection. Appearently, the powers that be at MOTOWN and UNIVERSAL decided to go with a "MIRACLES" collection instead of just focusing on SMOKEY.  I APPLAUD THIS DECISION. FOR TOO LONG,the MIRACLES have been COMPLETELY IGNORED for their many contrbutions in music history,and DENIED their importance as MOTOWN'S VERY FIRST GROUP.THE GROUP WHO'S  HITS BUILT THE COMPANY. With the passing of time , people tend to forget that,before there was a "SMOKEY ROBINSON" OR A "SMOKEY ROBINSON AND THE MIRACLES",There was just "THE MIRACLES" the group of 6 young teen-agers from the streets of Detroit-who were hungry for success,and had talent to burn.And,for the FIRST 10 YEARS OF THEIR EXISTENCE,THAT IS HOW THEY WERE BILLED. WILLIAM "SMOKEY" ROBINSON, BOBBY ROGERS, WARREN "PETE" MOORE, CLAUDETTE ROGERS ROBINSON, RONNIE WHITE,AND MARV TARPLIN deserve MUCH BETTER than to have their legacy simply swept under the rug by disc jockeys, music historians,and others who simply DONT KNOW OR CARE about music history or about their accomplishments AS A GROUP,in the current hoopla over SMOKEY AS A SOLO ARTIST. TIME AND AGAIN, OLD MIRACLES SONGS ARE PLAYED ON OLDIES STATIONS ACROSS THIS COUNTRY... WITH DISC JOCKEYS announcing "that was by SMOKEY ROBINSON "- NOT MENTIONING THE MIRACLES AT ALL,AS IF THEY DIDN'T,OR HAD NEVER EXISTED.THIS SAME NEGATIVE ATTITUDE HAS EXTENDED ITSELF TO THE UPPER ECHELONS OF THE MUSIC INDUSTRY. IN 1987, THE ROCK AND ROLL HALL OF FAME INDUCTED SMOKEY ROBINSON AS A SOLO ARTIST, COMPLETELY IGNORING THE OTHER MIRACLES,A SLIGHT AND INSULT THAT NO OTHER MAJOR MOTOWN GROUP (EXCEPT THE MARVELETTES) HAS HAD TO ENDURE....AND THIS WAS DONE TO MOTOWN'S VERY FIRST GROUP...THE MOST HISTORICALLY IMPORTANT ONE... THE ONE GROUP THAT STARTED THE ENTIRE MOTOWN PHENOMONON !! AND, OVER THE YEARS ,THEY'VE MADE NO EFFORT TO CORRECT THIS OVERSIGHT ,INDUCTING OTHER GROUPS WITH NOWHERE NEAR THE NUMBER OF HITS... AND NOWHERE NEAR AS INFLUENTIAL...(THE MIRACLES' SONGS HAVE BEEN RECORDED BY EVERYONE FROM THE BEATLES AND THE STONES TO FRANK SINATRA AND LINDA RONSTADT } AND ALMOST ALL OF THE MIRACLES' HITS WERE SELF WRITTEN GROUP COMPOSITIONS.(SOMETHING NO OTHER "GOLDEN ERA" MOTOWN GROUP CAN CLAIM !!} HOPEFULLY, ONE DAY , THEY WILL BE INDUCTED. THE YEAR 2007 MARKS THE 50 TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE MIRACLES... AND I'M GLAD THAT THIS NEW DVD GOES A LONG WAY TO CORRECT THIS PROBLEM ....WITH ORIGINAL MIRACLES PETE MOORE AND BOBBY ROGERS JOINING SMOKEY (ALTHOUGH IT WOULD HAVE BEEN NICE TO HAVE HAD ALL THE SURVIVING MIRACLES,INCLUDING MARV & CLAUDETTE,PRESENT},IT STILL GOES A LONG WAY TO REMIND PEOPLE THAT THE PUBLIC FIRST FELL IN LOVE WITH THE MIRACLES AS A GROUP -LONG BEFORE ONE OF THEM WAS SEPARATED FROM AND PLACED ABOVE THE REST BY THEIR RECORD LABEL (THE REASONS FOR THE NAME CHANGE ARE EXPLAINED ON THIS DISC).THIS WAS A WONDERFUL REUNION,AND IT SEEMED AS THOUGH ANY PAST PROBLEMS OR DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THEM HAD JUST MELTED AWAY. A FEW GRIPES...WHY DOES THE MIRACLES "DEFINITIVE COLLECTION" HAVE ONLY 14 SONGS ,WHILE ALL THE OTHER DISCS IN THIS SERIES HAVE 16 ? ALSO, I THINK THAT THIS COLLECTION SHOULD HAVE FOCUSED ONLY ON THE MIRACLES' COLLECTIVE ACCOMPLISHMENTS--WITH A SECOND VOLUME DEVOTED TO SMOKEY'S SOLO SUCCESSES-THESE TWO STEPS WOULD HAVE FREED UP ROOM FOR SOME GREAT MIRACLES HITS THAT WERE OMITTED... SUCH AS "BABY BABY DONT CRY,"IF YOU CAN WANT"," MORE LOVE","I LIKE IT LIKE THAT", "JUST A MIRAGE","{COME ROUND HERE} I'M THE ONE YOU NEED","FORK IN THE ROAD","I GOTTA DANCE TO KEEP FROM CRYING",  "WHATS SO GOOD ABOUT GOOD BYE",OR "SPECIAL OCCASION"...ALL HUGE HITS THAT WERE NOT INCLUDED .(the MIRACLES have had over 50 chart hits... why are only 11 of them on this video) ?...ALSO, WHY WAS SMOKEY'S REPLACEMENT IN THE GROUP, BILLY GRIFFIN, WHO SANG LEAD ON TWO OF THE GROUP'S TWO BIGGEST HITS,"DO IT BABY,AND "LOVE MACHINE" NOT INTERVIEWED? AND FINALLY.. WHY WAS THERE NO TRIBUTE TO THE LATE RONNIE WHITE...THE ONLY MIRACLES MEMBER NO LONGER WITH US... THE MAN WHO DISCOVERED STEVIE WONDER AND WHO CO- WROTE ONE OF THE GREATEST CLASSICS OF ALL TIME --THE TEMPTATIONS'"MY GIRL" (A SONG THAT WAS ORIGINALLY INTENDED FOR THE MIRACLES).I WAS LOOKING FOR IT , BUT HE WAS ONLY MENTIONED IN PASSING (AT LEAST MARV TARPLIN FINALLY GOT HIS PROPS AS AN ORIGINAL MEMBER...HE WAS MENTIONED THROUGHOUT THE DISC!}  I HOPE A "VOLUME TWO " IS PLANNED... IT WILL GO A LONG WAY TOWARD CORRECTING THESE OVERSIGHTS.... BUT OVERALL,THIS IS A FANTASTIC COLLECTION... ESPECIALLY THE ACAPELLA SECTION ..THOSE HARMONIES SHOW JUST WHAT A GREAT SINGING GROUP THE MIRACLES WERE...ALSO THE DETAILED STORIES BEHIND THE CREATION OF THEIR GREATEST HITS...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR ANY MUSIC COLLECTION.IT IS MY SINCERE HOPE THAT THIS COLLECTION WILL FINALLY SERVE TO RESTORE the legendary MIRACLES ,THE GROUP,TO THEIR RIGHTFUL PLACE IN MUSIC HISTORY . 5 STARS!!!  P.S. IT HAS LONG BEEN RUMORED (AND CONFIRMED BY SMOKEY HIMSELF)THAT  THE MIRACLES' HISTORIC FINAL CONCERT TOGETHER, AT THE CARTER-BARRON AMPITHEATRE (WASH. D.C.) IN 1972 WAS ACTUALLY VIDEOTAPED IN MOVIE FORM,BUT WAS NEVER PUBLICLY RELEASED,ALTHOUGH FILM CLIPS OF IT DID SHOW UP ON THE MIRACLES' 1990 SHOWTIME TV SPECIAL.(AS WELL AS IN AUDIO, ON THE DOUBLE ALBUM 1957-1972) MOTOWN....PLEASE RELEASE THIS CONCERT ON DVD !!!****FLASH ****Since I first posted this review several years ago, THE MIRACLES have since been inducted into THE ROCK AND ROLL HALL OF FAME (2012 Induction Class). As Motown's First Group, they should have been the first to be inducted ....but, better late than never . CONGRATS to ALL of THE MIRACLES...and to the memories of MARV and RONNIE (RIP).
summary: the MIRACLES ..... FIRST OF THE GREAT MOTOWN GROUPS !!
